title: feat(spice): prevent spice simulation from autorunning
description: This PR prevents the SPICE simulation from running automatically when the overlay is opened, requiring user action to trigger the simulation.
body:
This PR prevents the SPICE simulation from running automatically when the overlay is opened.                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                   
The simulation is now only triggered when the user clicks the "Run" button. This provides a better user experience by giving explicit control over when the potentially long-running simulation is executed.

title: feat: Support fp_poly kicad_mod directive
description: Adds support for the fp_poly directive in KiCad module files, enabling conversion of polygon shapes on copper, silkscreen, and fabrication layers into appropriate circuit elements.
body:
This change introduces support for the fp_poly directive in KiCad module files.                                                 

The implementation handles polygons on various layers:                                                                                          

 • Copper layers (.Cu): Rectangular polygons are converted to filled pcb_smtpad elements. Non-rectangular polygons are converted to pcb_trace   
   elements.                                                                                                                                    
 • Silkscreen layers (.SilkS): Converted to pcb_silkscreen_path.                                                                                
 • Fabrication layers (.Fab): Converted to pcb_fabrication_note_path.                                                                           

New tests have been added to verify the conversion of polygons on both silkscreen and copper layers, including a case where a polygon trace connects two pads.

/claim #133
/closes #133

title: Fix tooltip positioning when 3d-viewer is embedded in external sites
description: Fixes tooltip positioning calculations to ensure tooltips are displayed correctly when the 3D viewer is embedded in containers with different positioning contexts.
body:
Cause
The [Html.tsx](cci:7://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/3d-viewer/src/react-three/Html.tsx:0:0-0:0) component was using page-level absolute positioning (`rect.left + x, rect.top + y`) for tooltips, which fails when the viewer is embedded in containers with different positioning contexts.

## Changes Made
### [src/react-three/Html.tsx](cci:7://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/3d-viewer/src/react-three/Html.tsx:0:0-0:0)
- **Fixed positioning calculations**: Changed from page-level coordinates to container-relative positioning by removing `rect.left` and `rect.top` offsets
- **Added container positioning**: Ensured the renderer's parent node has `position: relative` to properly contain absolutely positioned tooltips  
- **Added explicit z-index**: Set `zIndex: "1000"` to ensure tooltips appear above other content


## Testing
yalced the 3d-viewer to tscircuit.com repo for testing 
Before with latest 3d-viewer version 

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e71fb659-85d2-49ca-9c52-8237973dbb1d



After the fix

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7ee32367-d5af-4f0a-a2c5-bf8be2ed7123


Ref #466

title: feat(pcb): Implement copper pour component
description: Adds a new copperpour  primitive component for creating copper fills on PCB layers, including a CopperPour class and a new rendering phase for PCB copper pours.
body:
Introduces a new `<copperpour />` primitive component for creating copper fills on PCB layers.                                                                        
                                                                                                                                                                      
The implementation adds a `CopperPour` class that performs the following during a new `PcbCopperPourRender` phase:                                                    
- It gets the board outline and all PCB obstacles on the specified layer.                                                                                             
- It uses `flatten-js` to perform boolean subtractions of obstacles from the board area, creating the pour geometry.                                                  
- Obstacles connected to the same net as the pour are not subtracted, effectively creating thermals (though thermals themselves are not yet explicitly modeled).                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                                                      
A new `PcbCopperPourRender` phase is added to the rendering pipeline with appropriate async dependencies on trace and footprint rendering.                            
                                                                                                                                                                      
New tests with PCB snapshots are added to verify the pours with custom board outlines and various obstacles.

title: fix(pcb): Correct arc rendering in BREP shapes
description: Fixes incorrect arc rendering in BREP shapes due to an inverted sweep-flag in the SVG arc path command.
body:
This PR addresses an issue where arcs in BREP shapes, such as those in copper pours, were being  
drawn in the opposite direction. The incorrect rendering was due to the sweep-flag for the SVG arc path
command being inverted.                                                                                

The fix involves correcting the logic for the sweep-flag in lib/utils/ring-to-path-d.ts to account for 
the Y-axis flip in the SVG coordinate system. This ensures that arcs in BREP shapes are now drawn      
correctly.

components with no real footprint (e.g. width/height ≤ 0 or degenerate polygons). Such components are now skipped during DRC checks.

title: feat: Implement BRep copper pours and improve arc drawing
description: Adds support for drawing pcb_copper_pour elements with the new brep shape and enhances arccircle drawing capabilities by correcting the create_arc command and refactoring circle drawing logic for improved accuracy.
body:
This PR introduces support for drawing pcb_copper_pour elements with the new brep shape and enhances arc/circle drawing capabilities.                

 • Implemented drawing logic for pcb_copper_pour elements that use shape: "brep".                                                                    
 • To conform to the Gerber specification, the winding order for outer_ring (clockwise to counter-clockwise) and inner_rings (counter-clockwise to clockwise) is now correctly reversed during processing.                                                                                           
 • This enables rendering of complex copper pour shapes with holes and curved edges (bulges).                                                        

 • Corrected the create_arc (G75) command to ensure it's properly enabled in the Gerber header.                                                      
 • Refactored pcb_cutout with shape: "circle" to be drawn using two semi-circular arc commands, replacing the previous line-segment approximation for more accurate output.

title: feat: Support importing GLTF files with binary assets
description: Adds support for importing .gltf files that reference external binary (.bin) or image assets, enabling inlining of these assets as data URIs within the GLTF JSON structure.
body:
This PR introduces support for importing `.gltf` files that have dependencies on external binary (`.bin`) or image assets.                                                                                            
                                                                                                 
1.  **File Resolution**: The `resolveFilePath` utility now recognizes the `.gltf` file extension.                 
2.  **Asset Inlining**: When a `.gltf` file is imported within the web worker:                                                       
    - The JSON file is parsed.                                                                                                       
    - It iterates through `buffers` and `images` to find any relative URIs.                                                          
    - For each relative URI, it resolves the path, reads the corresponding file from the `fsMap`, and converts its content into a    
`data:` URI (base64).                                                                                                                
    - This `data:` URI replaces the original relative URI in the GLTF JSON structure.                                                
3.  **Blob URL Creation**: A new `Blob` is created from the modified GLTF JSON, and a `blob:` URL is generated to represent the      
final, self-contained asset. This URL is returned as the default export of the imported module.                                      
                                                                                                               
A new integration test (`tests/features/import-gltf-file.test.tsx`) has been added to validate this feature. The test ensures that a `.gltf` file referencing an external `.bin` file is correctly processed and that the final `blob:` URL contains the inlined binary   
data as a `data:` URI.

title: fix(eval): Implement recursive NPM dependency resolution
description: Fixes an issue where NPM packages with their own dependencies (transitive dependencies) were not being resolved correctly by implementing recursive loading of those dependencies.
body:
This PR fixes an issue where NPM packages with their own dependencies (transitive dependencies) were not being resolved correctly.    
                                                                                                                                            
**Recursive NPM Imports:** The `importNpmPackage` and `importEvalPath` functions were updated to parse fetched NPM package code, find `import` statements, and recursively load those dependencies.                                                                                                    
**Robust Regex:** The import-parsing regex in `getImportsFromCode` was made more flexible to handle minified code where whitespace is removed.

title: fix: resolve local dev api not working
description: Fixes the faulty logic that prevented the local API from initializing in development environments, ensuring proper functionality for local testing.
body:
## Problem
The previous implementation used:

```ts
if (
  typeof window !== "undefined" &&
  (!window.location.origin.includes("vercel.app") ||
   !window.location.origin.includes(".com"))
) {
  // fallback
}
```

This logic is flawed:

* The condition always evaluates to `true` because of the `!… || !…` combination.
* As a result, the fallback message was always shown.
* The local API server never ran, even in development.

## Solution

This PR fixes this faulty check pattern that was introduced in [PR #898](https://github.com/tscircuit/runframe/pull/898/commits/ca3d8b0a7d8086034cb905af47ebcfa4096c69b0)

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d7a3e53-159d-43cd-9092-74b4b7f3f50d

[videolink here](https://bit.ly/runframe-api-fix)



## Impact

* Fixes broken examples (`example04`, `example05`) where the local API never initialized.
* Ensures contributors and maintainers can test locally without unexpected fallback behavior.

/claim #1100

title: feat(import): Add Kicad footprint search to import dialog
description: This took a while to get done, front end is annoying This PR introduces a new Kicad tab to the Import Component dialog, allowing users to search for and copy standard Kicad footprint names. New Kicad Tab: A dedicated tab for searching Kicad footprints. Fuzzy Search: Implements fuzzy searching using fuse.js against a cached list of Kicads standard library footprints. Copy to Clipboard: The primary action for a Kicad footprint is to copy the formatted string (e.g., kicad:Resistor_SMD:R_0402_1005Metric) to the users clipboard for easy use in their circuit code.
body:
This took a while to get done, front end is annoying

This PR introduces a new "Kicad" tab to the "Import Component" dialog, allowing users to search for and copy standard Kicad footprint names.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
- **New Kicad Tab:** A dedicated tab for searching Kicad footprints.                                                                          
- **Fuzzy Search:** Implements fuzzy searching using `fuse.js` against a cached list of Kicad's standard library footprints.                  
- **Copy to Clipboard:** The primary action for a Kicad footprint is to copy the formatted string (e.g.,                                      
`kicad:Resistor_SMD:R_0402_1005Metric`) to the user's clipboard for easy use in their circuit code.                                           

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f3efc65c-0421-41e0-8731-cfeeefdf345a
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2aba0842-7892-4d5f-8b4c-feb88e24349e

/claim #1122
/closes #1122

title: fix: remove stray trim from ChatGPT quickstart

title: Fix #235 - simplified path solver violating DRC error
description: Fixed 235 by updating version of tscircuitmath-utils and using correct function to not use manhattan distance. claim 235
body:
Fixed #235 by updating version of `@tscircuit/math-utils` and using correct function to not use manhattan distance.
/claim #235

body:

## Testing

title: Add a new `Upstream` categegory which focuses on the upstream of core version
description: Adds a new Upstream category to the dependency graph, allowing users to filter dependencies related to the core version used in circuit previews.
body: All these dependencies are important cause they are used in one way or the other for the circuit preview, either in docs, snapshots or the circuit rendering itself. So, all of them should have the latest core

title: add bounds to PackInput, add to visualizations
description: Adds bounds to the PackInput structure and visualizes these bounds in the packing algorithms.

title: Use obstacles when packing
description: Adds obstacle handling in the packing algorithm to ensure components maintain a minimum gap from obstacles during placement.
body:

- **add mingap check to obstacles before packing**

title: define type for obstacles
description: Adds a new InputObstacle type to define obstacles with properties such as obstacleId, absoluteCenter, width, and height for packing calculations.

title: feat: support chip margins in circuit json conversion
description: Allows the conversion of circuit JSON to pack output to expand pads using custom chip margins, enhancing the layout flexibility for PCB designs.
body:

title: fix the parsing issue of glb files in model viewer
description: Fixes the parsing issue of GLB files in the model viewer by adding a buffer reference to the embedded binary data and ensuring proper padding for JSON data according to the GLB specification.

title: svg-to-png conversion works in nodejs environment
description: Enables SVG to PNG conversion in a Node.js environment using native Resvg, with a fallback to browser method if the native import fails.

title: fix relative import
description: Fixes the relative import of the WASM file in the svg-to-png-browser utility to ensure proper loading in Node.js environments.

title: make sure the trace is connecting the first and last point
description: Ensures that the trace path connects the first and last points of the schematic trace solver, adding a sanity check for path validation.

title: repro: missing schematic-trace for some schOrientation
description: Adds a test case for the schematic trace solver to address missing schematic traces for certain orientations.
body: Ref - https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1328

title: NEW Micro Mod Board with two variants + outlineBuilder fn
description: Adds a new Micro Mod Board component with two variants (processor and function) and an outlineBuilder function for generating board outlines.
body:
/claim #4 
/closes #4

title: feat: Add Arduino Shield component with standard pin headers
description: Add ArduinoShield component with standard pin header configuration, including proper pin labeling for digital, analog, power, and communication pins, and footprint specifications for standard Arduino headers.
body:
## Description
- Implemented [ArduinoShield](cci:1://file://wsl.localhost/Ubuntu/home/abse/common/ArduinoShield.tsx:2:0-93:3) component with standard pin header configuration
- Included proper pin labeling for digital, analog, power, and communication pins
- Component accepts optional `name` prop and supports child components
- Added footprint specifications for standard Arduino headers

The implementation follows the standard Arduino Uno R4 pinout

/claim #1 
/closes #1
